newsitem.title: USA: Clinton accepts VA secretary's resignation.
newsitem.headline: Clinton accepts VA secretary's resignation.

text.p: President Clinton Saturday accepted the resignation of Veterans Affairs Secretary Jesse Brown and thanked him for his "unceasing commitment to the rights of veterans."
In a letter to Brown, Clinton accepted "with deep regret" the Cabinet officials decision to leave his post effective July 1.
"Your many contributions will long stand as evidence of your unceasing commitment to the rights of veterans and the honour they deserve," Clinton said.

Brown, a former Marine wounded in Vietnam, said in her letter of resignation that he was leaving his post after more than four year because its "responsibilities are too important to be treated or considered as career employment."
"To do so, would not be in the best interest of our veterans," he said.
